result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Lee White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 6-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Lee White

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 4 days at the House of Correction with 4 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 6-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Larry Lee White in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Defendant Larry Lee White in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/21/2015 received and filed. (10 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Terese Dick, 819 North 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI, 53203.

Defendant Larry Lee White in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Ron Dague for Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Rebecca Schultz-WI Department of Corrections Sex Offender Registry Specialist.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Defendant scheduled for surgery and will provide documentation to the Court if necessary.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/20/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Larry Lee White
Current: 828 W HAYES, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 04-09-2015)
Prior: Lka:  2217 S 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Larry Lee White in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Larry Lee White in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
